meanings.definition: A sudden burst of sunlight or a similar bright light.
meanings.sent1: The sunburst through the clouds was dazzling.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with a warm sunburst in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The sunburst made the room look like a magical place.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a sunburst, lighting up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The sunburst painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A design or pattern resembling the rays of the sun.
meanings.sent1: The stained glass window had a beautiful sunburst design.
meanings.sent2: The quilt had a sunburst pattern in the center.
meanings.sent3: The sunburst on the wall added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her earrings sparkled like a sunburst in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sunburst on the flag symbolized hope and warmth.

meanings.definition: To burst forth like the sun.
meanings.sent1: The flowers will sunburst open in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She felt her heart sunburst with joy at the news.
meanings.sent3: The music seemed to sunburst out of the speakers.
meanings.sent4: His laughter sunbursted through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The emotions sunburst from her like a fountain.
